name: The Ashley Inn of Tillamook

reviews.text: We are non-smokers who were glad to get a non-smoking room. We signed an agreement that we would not smoke in our room or there would be charges (we are non-smokers so thought nothing more about it). Big mistake. If you sign it make sure that someone looks at the room with you before you leave so there is a signed agreement that you did not smoke in the room. We received our charge card statement with an extra $300 added on to the bill. The hotel did not have the courtesy to even let us know they put it on our bill. They have pictures of cigarette butts which they claim were in our room but as we are non-smokers this is a mistake on their part which they refuse to acknowledge.
reviews.title: Beware non-smoking agreement.
not a good childrens motel
reviews.text: I stayed at the tillamook best western and was given a great price for my recent military service, but because of their customer service regarding children I am wishing I would have paid more at the motel across the street. I would recommend this motel as a great place to stay if you only need a place to sleep. I was treated rudley due to my young nephews spilling a little milk at the breakfast bar and spilling some ice near the machine. They were well supervised and simply spilt some ice and milk.

The managment handled it badly and instead of drawing my attention to it they called and theatened legal action. After speaking to the front desk i was informed a few ice cubes fell out of the bucket and some milk spilled during breakfast. Their tolerence of children was short and I would not recomend this motel to families ect.
reviews.title: Decent place to rest a night

reviews.text: We stayed at this motel for a July weekend. The room was clean, quiet and nicely furnished. Internet service was provided at no additional cost. A large Fred Meyer retail operation is next door and it contains a Starbucks. A breakfast of misc toasts, coffee, juice, hard boiled eggs, hot/cold cereal was provided by the BW and was sufficient to get us started for the day. We will likely visit Tillamook in six months and will stay at the BW Inn and Suites again. BTW, the Tillamook Cheese Factory is about 5 minutes away for this motel.
reviews.title: Will return to Tillamook BW Inn and Suites

reviews.text: I'm not usually one to stay at chain hotels, and I'd had a prior bad experience with a Best Western earlier in my cross-country road trip so I was a little hesitant to try one again. However, this seemed to be one of the only decent-looking hotels in town, and very conveniently located right across the street from the Tillamook Cheese Factory.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay and restful sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was supremely comfortable. My best night's sleep in a week. Linens were all new and of high-quality. Wireless internet worked well. The hotel was quiet and the staff very friendly. The breakfast was of decent quality, and though we arrived late, there was still plenty to choose from.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Tillamook!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I'm ever back in Tillamook I would definitely stay here again. It was a wonderful place to rest and relax after a long day's driving.
reviews.title: Clean Large Rooms

reviews.text: The experience at the Best Western in Tillamook was amazing compared to the last time we stayed across the street (I don't mind name dropping the Shilo Inn). We were greeted by a friendly young woman at the counter who gave us our AARP discount even though we didn't have our card on us. We came in late, so she helped us find a place for dinner by calling to make sure the restaurant was opened. She also recommended a couple places to eat. There was a good selection of DVDs in the lobby. Our room was clean and had good accommodations compared to "across the street." Nice shower, comfortable bed, lots of pillows and easy access to ice and vending machine. When we return to Tillamook, and we will, we are definitely staying at the Best Western! Oh, and about the smell, you are in Tillamook for goodness sake -- land of cheese (cows), trees and ocean breeze.
reviews.title: The worst inn ever

reviews.text: My car navigator sent me to this hotel. As I drove to the hotel, the hotel marquis indicated "hot breakfast." How disappointing the next morning to find out they consider "hot breakfast." biscuits and gravy and frozen pancakes. At check in, the clerk was adamant about me signing a no smoking waiver, however, when I went to the room, there was several cigarette burns on the carpets. When I notified the same clerk , she simply shrugged her shoulders. I am a Best Western Diamond Gold Crown member (stayed 60 days this year at Best Western's) and I was shocked the hotel charged me $10 extra to check out 50 minutes late. To say the least, the service is lacking at this hotel. I would not recommend it. I would say maybe make the drive to Cannon Beach. Also, I was very surprised their website says 'new' when that is far from the truth. When I asked the clerk, she said, the hotel is 9 years old. When I said, why do you advertise new and she said, "it's the newest hotel."
reviews.title: Not a good choice of hotels

likes.liked: — It' was near a Starbucks at Fred Meyer

reviews.title: Big room, good breakfast, great staff
reviews.text: We came here because of rude service at the hotel across the street. We got a nice big room with a king bed, a great off season discount from the friendly front desk staff member.
There was a field across the street where I could play with my dogs, and a Fred Meyer nextdoor where we could get some munchies for the room.
reviews.title: It was a place to sleep

reviews.text: Each room has a dvd player and there's a great selection of movies in the lobby. The staff recommended a good restaurant for dinner, and offered directions and asked if there was anything else we needed.
reviews.title: nothing special but not bad either

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was good, including toaster waffles and eggs, although the cereal could have been filled up, there really wasnt any available, but they could have been waiting for a delivery. The coffee was very strong and excellent! We stayed 2 nights and definitely would again!
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay!

aka: The Ashley Inn Of Tillamook Hotel
description: Choose one of 51 well-appointed guest rooms featuring air conditioning, high-speed Internet access (wired and WiFi), cable television and DVD players. Mini-suites are also available and come with a sofa bed.
